intro: Mesomelaena stygia subsp. stygia, commonly known as the Stygian mesomelaena, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the humid lowland forests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dark, almost black foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom during the wet season. The plant exhibits a unique adaptation to its environment, with thick, waxy leaves that help retain moisture in the shaded, moist undergrowth. It is typically found in association with other epiphytic and lithophytic species, growing on tree trunks or rocky outcrops.
